30#include <sys/cdefs.h>
31__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: intel_opregion.c,v 1.14 2018/08/27 13:54:48 riastradh Exp $");
32
33#include <linux/printk.h>
34#include <linux/acpi.h>
35#include <acpi/video.h>
36#include <asm/io.h>
37
38#include <drm/drmP.h>
39#include <drm/i915_drm.h>
40#include "i915_drv.h"
41#include "intel_drv.h"
42
43#ifdef CONFIG_ACPI
44
45#define PCI_ASLE 0xe4
46#define PCI_ASLS 0xfc
47#define PCI_SWSCI 0xe8
48#define PCI_SWSCI_SCISEL (1 << 15)
49#define PCI_SWSCI_GSSCIE (1 << 0)
50
51#define OPREGION_HEADER_OFFSET 0
52#define OPREGION_ACPI_OFFSET 0x100
53#define ACPI_CLID 0x01ac /* current lid state indicator */
54#define ACPI_CDCK 0x01b0 /* current docking state indicator */
55#define OPREGION_SWSCI_OFFSET 0x200
56#define OPREGION_ASLE_OFFSET 0x300
57#define OPREGION_VBT_OFFSET 0x400
58
59#define OPREGION_SIGNATURE "IntelGraphicsMem"
60#define MBOX_ACPI (1<<0)
61#define MBOX_SWSCI (1<<1)
62#define MBOX_ASLE (1<<2)
63#define MBOX_ASLE_EXT (1<<4)
64
65struct opregion_header {
66 u8 signature[16];
67 u32 size;
68 u32 opregion_ver;
69 u8 bios_ver[32];
70 u8 vbios_ver[16];
71 u8 driver_ver[16];
72 u32 mboxes;
73 u32 driver_model;
74 u32 pcon;
75 u8 dver[32];
76 u8 rsvd[124];
77} __packed;
78
79/* OpRegion mailbox #1: public ACPI methods */
80struct opregion_acpi {
81 u32 drdy; /* driver readiness */
82 u32 csts; /* notification status */
83 u32 cevt; /* current event */
84 u8 rsvd1[20];
85 u32 didl[8]; /* supported display devices ID list */
86 u32 cpdl[8]; /* currently presented display list */
87 u32 cadl[8]; /* currently active display list */
88 u32 nadl[8]; /* next active devices list */
89 u32 aslp; /* ASL sleep time-out */
90 u32 tidx; /* toggle table index */
91 u32 chpd; /* current hotplug enable indicator */
92 u32 clid; /* current lid state*/
93 u32 cdck; /* current docking state */
94 u32 sxsw; /* Sx state resume */
95 u32 evts; /* ASL supported events */
96 u32 cnot; /* current OS notification */
97 u32 nrdy; /* driver status */
98 u32 did2[7]; /* extended supported display devices ID list */
99 u32 cpd2[7]; /* extended attached display devices list */
100 u8 rsvd2[4];
101} __packed;
102
103/* OpRegion mailbox #2: SWSCI */
104struct opregion_swsci {
105 u32 scic; /* SWSCI command|status|data */
106 u32 parm; /* command parameters */
107 u32 dslp; /* driver sleep time-out */
108 u8 rsvd[244];
109} __packed;
110
111/* OpRegion mailbox #3: ASLE */
112struct opregion_asle {
113 u32 ardy; /* driver readiness */
114 u32 aslc; /* ASLE interrupt command */
115 u32 tche; /* technology enabled indicator */
116 u32 alsi; /* current ALS illuminance reading */
117 u32 bclp; /* backlight brightness to set */
118 u32 pfit; /* panel fitting state */
119 u32 cblv; /* current brightness level */
120 u16 bclm[20]; /* backlight level duty cycle mapping table */
121 u32 cpfm; /* current panel fitting mode */
122 u32 epfm; /* enabled panel fitting modes */
123 u8 plut[74]; /* panel LUT and identifier */
124 u32 pfmb; /* PWM freq and min brightness */
125 u32 cddv; /* color correction default values */
126 u32 pcft; /* power conservation features */
127 u32 srot; /* supported rotation angles */
128 u32 iuer; /* IUER events */
129 u64 fdss;
130 u32 fdsp;
131 u32 stat;
132 u8 rsvd[70];
133} __packed;
134
135/* Driver readiness indicator */
136#define ASLE_ARDY_READY (1 << 0)
137#define ASLE_ARDY_NOT_READY (0 << 0)
138
139/* ASLE Interrupt Command (ASLC) bits */
140#define ASLC_SET_ALS_ILLUM (1 << 0)
141#define ASLC_SET_BACKLIGHT (1 << 1)
142#define ASLC_SET_PFIT (1 << 2)
143#define ASLC_SET_PWM_FREQ (1 << 3)
144#define ASLC_SUPPORTED_ROTATION_ANGLES (1 << 4)
145#define ASLC_BUTTON_ARRAY (1 << 5)
146#define ASLC_CONVERTIBLE_INDICATOR (1 << 6)
147#define ASLC_DOCKING_INDICATOR (1 << 7)
148#define ASLC_ISCT_STATE_CHANGE (1 << 8)
149#define ASLC_REQ_MSK 0x1ff
150/* response bits */
151#define ASLC_ALS_ILLUM_FAILED (1 << 10)
152#define ASLC_BACKLIGHT_FAILED (1 << 12)
153#define ASLC_PFIT_FAILED (1 << 14)
154#define ASLC_PWM_FREQ_FAILED (1 << 16)
155#define ASLC_ROTATION_ANGLES_FAILED (1 << 18)
156#define ASLC_BUTTON_ARRAY_FAILED (1 << 20)
157#define ASLC_CONVERTIBLE_FAILED (1 << 22)
158#define ASLC_DOCKING_FAILED (1 << 24)
159#define ASLC_ISCT_STATE_FAILED (1 << 26)
160
161/* Technology enabled indicator */
162#define ASLE_TCHE_ALS_EN (1 << 0)
163#define ASLE_TCHE_BLC_EN (1 << 1)
164#define ASLE_TCHE_PFIT_EN (1 << 2)
165#define ASLE_TCHE_PFMB_EN (1 << 3)
166
167/* ASLE backlight brightness to set */
168#define ASLE_BCLP_VALID (1<<31)
169#define ASLE_BCLP_MSK (~(1<<31))
170
171/* ASLE panel fitting request */
172#define ASLE_PFIT_VALID (1<<31)
173#define ASLE_PFIT_CENTER (1<<0)
174#define ASLE_PFIT_STRETCH_TEXT (1<<1)
175#define ASLE_PFIT_STRETCH_GFX (1<<2)
176
177/* PWM frequency and minimum brightness */
178#define ASLE_PFMB_BRIGHTNESS_MASK (0xff)
179#define ASLE_PFMB_BRIGHTNESS_VALID (1<<8)
180#define ASLE_PFMB_PWM_MASK (0x7ffffe00)
181#define ASLE_PFMB_PWM_VALID (1<<31)
182
183#define ASLE_CBLV_VALID (1<<31)
184
185/* IUER */
186#define ASLE_IUER_DOCKING (1 << 7)
187#define ASLE_IUER_CONVERTIBLE (1 << 6)
188#define ASLE_IUER_ROTATION_LOCK_BTN (1 << 4)
189#define ASLE_IUER_VOLUME_DOWN_BTN (1 << 3)
190#define ASLE_IUER_VOLUME_UP_BTN (1 << 2)
191#define ASLE_IUER_WINDOWS_BTN (1 << 1)
192#define ASLE_IUER_POWER_BTN (1 << 0)
193
194/* Software System Control Interrupt (SWSCI) */
195#define SWSCI_SCIC_INDICATOR (1 << 0)
196#define SWSCI_SCIC_MAIN_FUNCTION_SHIFT 1
197#define SWSCI_SCIC_MAIN_FUNCTION_MASK (0xf << 1)
198#define SWSCI_SCIC_SUB_FUNCTION_SHIFT 8
199#define SWSCI_SCIC_SUB_FUNCTION_MASK (0xff << 8)
200#define SWSCI_SCIC_EXIT_PARAMETER_SHIFT 8
201#define SWSCI_SCIC_EXIT_PARAMETER_MASK (0xff << 8)
202#define SWSCI_SCIC_EXIT_STATUS_SHIFT 5
203#define SWSCI_SCIC_EXIT_STATUS_MASK (7 << 5)
204#define SWSCI_SCIC_EXIT_STATUS_SUCCESS 1
205
206#define SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(main, sub) \
207 ((main) << SWSCI_SCIC_MAIN_FUNCTION_SHIFT | \
208 (sub) << SWSCI_SCIC_SUB_FUNCTION_SHIFT)
209
210/* SWSCI: Get BIOS Data (GBDA) */
211#define SWSCI_GBDA 4
212#define SWSCI_GBDA_SUPPORTED_CALLS SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_GBDA, 0)
213#define SWSCI_GBDA_REQUESTED_CALLBACKS SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_GBDA, 1)
214#define SWSCI_GBDA_BOOT_DISPLAY_PREF SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_GBDA, 4)
215#define SWSCI_GBDA_PANEL_DETAILS SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_GBDA, 5)
216#define SWSCI_GBDA_TV_STANDARD SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_GBDA, 6)
217#define SWSCI_GBDA_INTERNAL_GRAPHICS SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_GBDA, 7)
218#define SWSCI_GBDA_SPREAD_SPECTRUM SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_GBDA, 10)
219
220/* SWSCI: System BIOS Callbacks (SBCB) */
221#define SWSCI_SBCB 6
222#define SWSCI_SBCB_SUPPORTED_CALLBACKS SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_SBCB, 0)
223#define SWSCI_SBCB_INIT_COMPLETION SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_SBCB, 1)
224#define SWSCI_SBCB_PRE_HIRES_SET_MODE SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_SBCB, 3)
225#define SWSCI_SBCB_POST_HIRES_SET_MODE SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_SBCB, 4)
226#define SWSCI_SBCB_DISPLAY_SWITCH SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_SBCB, 5)
227#define SWSCI_SBCB_SET_TV_FORMAT SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_SBCB, 6)
228#define SWSCI_SBCB_ADAPTER_POWER_STATE SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_SBCB, 7)
229#define SWSCI_SBCB_DISPLAY_POWER_STATE SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_SBCB, 8)
230#define SWSCI_SBCB_SET_BOOT_DISPLAY SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_SBCB, 9)
231#define SWSCI_SBCB_SET_PANEL_DETAILS SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_SBCB, 10)
232#define SWSCI_SBCB_SET_INTERNAL_GFX SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_SBCB, 11)
233#define SWSCI_SBCB_POST_HIRES_TO_DOS_FS SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_SBCB, 16)
234#define SWSCI_SBCB_SUSPEND_RESUME SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_SBCB, 17)
235#define SWSCI_SBCB_SET_SPREAD_SPECTRUM SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_SBCB, 18)
236#define SWSCI_SBCB_POST_VBE_PM SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_SBCB, 19)
237#define SWSCI_SBCB_ENABLE_DISABLE_AUDIO SWSCI_FUNCTION_CODE(SWSCI_SBCB, 21)
238
239#define ACPI_OTHER_OUTPUT (0<<8)
240#define ACPI_VGA_OUTPUT (1<<8)
241#define ACPI_TV_OUTPUT (2<<8)
242#define ACPI_DIGITAL_OUTPUT (3<<8)
243#define ACPI_LVDS_OUTPUT (4<<8)
244
245#define MAX_DSLP 1500
246
247#ifdef CONFIG_ACPI
248static int swsci(struct drm_device *dev, u32 function, u32 parm, u32 *parm_out)
249{
250 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
251 struct opregion_swsci *region_swsci = dev_priv->opregion.swsci;
252 u32 main_function, sub_function, scic;
253 u16 pci_swsci;
254 u32 dslp;
255
256 if (!region_swsci)
257 return -ENODEV;
258
259 main_function = (function & SWSCI_SCIC_MAIN_FUNCTION_MASK) >>
260 SWSCI_SCIC_MAIN_FUNCTION_SHIFT;
261 sub_function = (function & SWSCI_SCIC_SUB_FUNCTION_MASK) >>
262 SWSCI_SCIC_SUB_FUNCTION_SHIFT;
263
264 /* Check if we can call the function. See swsci_setup for details. */
265 if (main_function == SWSCI_SBCB) {
266 if ((dev_priv->opregion.swsci_sbcb_sub_functions &
267 (1 << sub_function)) == 0)
268 return -EINVAL;
269 } else if (main_function == SWSCI_GBDA) {
270 if ((dev_priv->opregion.swsci_gbda_sub_functions &
271 (1 << sub_function)) == 0)
272 return -EINVAL;
273 }
274
275 /* Driver sleep timeout in ms. */
276 dslp = region_swsci->dslp;
277 if (!dslp) {
278 /* The spec says 2ms should be the default, but it's too small
279 * for some machines. */
280 dslp = 50;
281 } else if (dslp > MAX_DSLP) {
282 /* Hey bios, trust must be earned. */
283 DRM_INFO_ONCE("ACPI BIOS requests an excessive sleep of %u ms, "
284 "using %u ms instead\n", dslp, MAX_DSLP);
285 dslp = MAX_DSLP;
286 }
287
288 /* The spec tells us to do this, but we are the only user... */
289 scic = region_swsci->scic;
290 if (scic & SWSCI_SCIC_INDICATOR) {
291 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("SWSCI request already in progress\n");
292 return -EBUSY;
293 }
294
295 scic = function | SWSCI_SCIC_INDICATOR;
296
297 region_swsci->parm = parm;
298 region_swsci->scic = scic;
299
300 /* Ensure SCI event is selected and event trigger is cleared. */
301 pci_read_config_word(dev->pdev, PCI_SWSCI, &pci_swsci);
302 if (!(pci_swsci & PCI_SWSCI_SCISEL) || (pci_swsci & PCI_SWSCI_GSSCIE)) {
303 pci_swsci |= PCI_SWSCI_SCISEL;
304 pci_swsci &= ~PCI_SWSCI_GSSCIE;
305 pci_write_config_word(dev->pdev, PCI_SWSCI, pci_swsci);
306 }
307
308 /* Use event trigger to tell bios to check the mail. */
309 pci_swsci |= PCI_SWSCI_GSSCIE;
310 pci_write_config_word(dev->pdev, PCI_SWSCI, pci_swsci);
311
312 /* Poll for the result. */
313#define C (((scic = region_swsci->scic) & SWSCI_SCIC_INDICATOR) == 0)
314 if (wait_for(C, dslp)) {
315 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("SWSCI request timed out\n");
316 return -ETIMEDOUT;
317 }
318
319 scic = (scic & SWSCI_SCIC_EXIT_STATUS_MASK) >>
320 SWSCI_SCIC_EXIT_STATUS_SHIFT;
321
322 /* Note: scic == 0 is an error! */
323 if (scic != SWSCI_SCIC_EXIT_STATUS_SUCCESS) {
324 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("SWSCI request error %u\n", scic);
325 return -EIO;
326 }
327
328 if (parm_out)
329 *parm_out = region_swsci->parm;
330
331 return 0;
332
333#undef C
334}
335
336#define DISPLAY_TYPE_CRT 0
337#define DISPLAY_TYPE_TV 1
338#define DISPLAY_TYPE_EXTERNAL_FLAT_PANEL 2
339#define DISPLAY_TYPE_INTERNAL_FLAT_PANEL 3
340
341int intel_opregion_notify_encoder(struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder,
342 bool enable)
343{
344 struct drm_device *dev = intel_encoder->base.dev;
345 u32 parm = 0;
346 u32 type = 0;
347 u32 port;
348
349 /* don't care about old stuff for now */
350 if (!HAS_DDI(dev))
351 return 0;
352
353 if (intel_encoder->type == INTEL_OUTPUT_DSI)
354 port = 0;
355 else
356 port = intel_ddi_get_encoder_port(intel_encoder);
357
358 if (port == PORT_E) {
359 port = 0;
360 } else {
361 parm |= 1 << port;
362 port++;
363 }
364
365 if (!enable)
366 parm |= 4 << 8;
367
368 switch (intel_encoder->type) {
369 case INTEL_OUTPUT_ANALOG:
370 type = DISPLAY_TYPE_CRT;
371 break;
372 case INTEL_OUTPUT_UNKNOWN:
373 case INTEL_OUTPUT_DISPLAYPORT:
374 case INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI:
375 case INTEL_OUTPUT_DP_MST:
376 type = DISPLAY_TYPE_EXTERNAL_FLAT_PANEL;
377 break;
378 case INTEL_OUTPUT_EDP:
379 case INTEL_OUTPUT_DSI:
380 type = DISPLAY_TYPE_INTERNAL_FLAT_PANEL;
381 break;
382 default:
383 WARN_ONCE(1, "unsupported intel_encoder type %d\n",
384 intel_encoder->type);
385 return -EINVAL;
386 }
387
388 parm |= type << (16 + port * 3);
389
390 return swsci(dev, SWSCI_SBCB_DISPLAY_POWER_STATE, parm, NULL);
391}
392
393static const struct {
394 pci_power_t pci_power_state;
395 u32 parm;
396} power_state_map[] = {
397 { PCI_D0, 0x00 },
398 { PCI_D1, 0x01 },
399 { PCI_D2, 0x02 },
400 { PCI_D3hot, 0x04 },
401 { PCI_D3cold, 0x04 },
402};
403
404int intel_opregion_notify_adapter(struct drm_device *dev, pci_power_t state)
405{
406 int i;
407
408 if (!HAS_DDI(dev))
409 return 0;
410
411 for (i = 0; i < ARRAY_SIZE(power_state_map); i++) {
412 if (state == power_state_map[i].pci_power_state)
413 return swsci(dev, SWSCI_SBCB_ADAPTER_POWER_STATE,
414 power_state_map[i].parm, NULL);
415 }
416
417 return -EINVAL;
418}
419
420static u32 asle_set_backlight(struct drm_device *dev, u32 bclp)
421{
422 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
423 struct intel_connector *intel_connector;
424 struct opregion_asle *asle = dev_priv->opregion.asle;
425
426 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("bclp = 0x%08x\n", bclp);
427
428#ifndef __NetBSD__ /* XXX backlight */
429 if (acpi_video_get_backlight_type() == acpi_backlight_native) {
430 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("opregion backlight request ignored\n");
431 return 0;
432 }
433#endif
434
435 if (!(bclp & ASLE_BCLP_VALID))
436 return ASLC_BACKLIGHT_FAILED;
437
438 bclp &= ASLE_BCLP_MSK;
439 if (bclp > 255)
440 return ASLC_BACKLIGHT_FAILED;
441
442 drm_modeset_lock(&dev->mode_config.connection_mutex, NULL);
443
444 /*
445 * Update backlight on all connectors that support backlight (usually
446 * only one).
447 */
448 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("updating opregion backlight %d/255\n", bclp);
449 list_for_each_entry(intel_connector, &dev->mode_config.connector_list, base.head)
450 intel_panel_set_backlight_acpi(intel_connector, bclp, 255);
451 asle->cblv = DIV_ROUND_UP(bclp * 100, 255) | ASLE_CBLV_VALID;
452
453 drm_modeset_unlock(&dev->mode_config.connection_mutex);
454
455
456 return 0;
457}
458
459static u32 asle_set_als_illum(struct drm_device *dev, u32 alsi)
460{
461 /* alsi is the current ALS reading in lux. 0 indicates below sensor
462 range, 0xffff indicates above sensor range. 1-0xfffe are valid */
463 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Illum is not supported\n");
464 return ASLC_ALS_ILLUM_FAILED;
465}
466
467static u32 asle_set_pwm_freq(struct drm_device *dev, u32 pfmb)
468{
469 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("PWM freq is not supported\n");
470 return ASLC_PWM_FREQ_FAILED;
471}
472
473static u32 asle_set_pfit(struct drm_device *dev, u32 pfit)
474{
475 /* Panel fitting is currently controlled by the X code, so this is a
476 noop until modesetting support works fully */
477 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Pfit is not supported\n");
478 return ASLC_PFIT_FAILED;
479}
480
481static u32 asle_set_supported_rotation_angles(struct drm_device *dev, u32 srot)
482{
483 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("SROT is not supported\n");
484 return ASLC_ROTATION_ANGLES_FAILED;
485}
486
487static u32 asle_set_button_array(struct drm_device *dev, u32 iuer)
488{
489 if (!iuer)
490 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Button array event is not supported (nothing)\n");
491 if (iuer & ASLE_IUER_ROTATION_LOCK_BTN)
492 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Button array event is not supported (rotation lock)\n");
493 if (iuer & ASLE_IUER_VOLUME_DOWN_BTN)
494 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Button array event is not supported (volume down)\n");
495 if (iuer & ASLE_IUER_VOLUME_UP_BTN)
496 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Button array event is not supported (volume up)\n");
497 if (iuer & ASLE_IUER_WINDOWS_BTN)
498 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Button array event is not supported (windows)\n");
499 if (iuer & ASLE_IUER_POWER_BTN)
500 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Button array event is not supported (power)\n");
501
502 return ASLC_BUTTON_ARRAY_FAILED;
503}
504
505static u32 asle_set_convertible(struct drm_device *dev, u32 iuer)
506{
507 if (iuer & ASLE_IUER_CONVERTIBLE)
508 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Convertible is not supported (clamshell)\n");
509 else
510 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Convertible is not supported (slate)\n");
511
512 return ASLC_CONVERTIBLE_FAILED;
513}
514
515static u32 asle_set_docking(struct drm_device *dev, u32 iuer)
516{
517 if (iuer & ASLE_IUER_DOCKING)
518 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Docking is not supported (docked)\n");
519 else
520 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Docking is not supported (undocked)\n");
521
522 return ASLC_DOCKING_FAILED;
523}
524
525static u32 asle_isct_state(struct drm_device *dev)
526{
527 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("ISCT is not supported\n");
528 return ASLC_ISCT_STATE_FAILED;
529}
530
531static void asle_work(struct work_struct *work)
532{
533 struct intel_opregion *opregion =
534 container_of(work, struct intel_opregion, asle_work);
535 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv =
536 container_of(opregion, struct drm_i915_private, opregion);
537 struct drm_device *dev = dev_priv->dev;
538 struct opregion_asle *asle = dev_priv->opregion.asle;
539 u32 aslc_stat = 0;
540 u32 aslc_req;
541
542 if (!asle)
543 return;
544
545 aslc_req = asle->aslc;
546
547 if (!(aslc_req & ASLC_REQ_MSK)) {
548 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("No request on ASLC interrupt 0x%08x\n",
549 aslc_req);
550 return;
551 }
552
553 if (aslc_req & ASLC_SET_ALS_ILLUM)
554 aslc_stat |= asle_set_als_illum(dev, asle->alsi);
555
556 if (aslc_req & ASLC_SET_BACKLIGHT)
557 aslc_stat |= asle_set_backlight(dev, asle->bclp);
558
559 if (aslc_req & ASLC_SET_PFIT)
560 aslc_stat |= asle_set_pfit(dev, asle->pfit);
561
562 if (aslc_req & ASLC_SET_PWM_FREQ)
563 aslc_stat |= asle_set_pwm_freq(dev, asle->pfmb);
564
565 if (aslc_req & ASLC_SUPPORTED_ROTATION_ANGLES)
566 aslc_stat |= asle_set_supported_rotation_angles(dev,
567 asle->srot);
568
569 if (aslc_req & ASLC_BUTTON_ARRAY)
570 aslc_stat |= asle_set_button_array(dev, asle->iuer);
571
572 if (aslc_req & ASLC_CONVERTIBLE_INDICATOR)
573 aslc_stat |= asle_set_convertible(dev, asle->iuer);
574
575 if (aslc_req & ASLC_DOCKING_INDICATOR)
576 aslc_stat |= asle_set_docking(dev, asle->iuer);
577
578 if (aslc_req & ASLC_ISCT_STATE_CHANGE)
579 aslc_stat |= asle_isct_state(dev);
580
581 asle->aslc = aslc_stat;
582}
583
584void intel_opregion_asle_intr(struct drm_device *dev)
585{
586 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
587
588 if (dev_priv->opregion.asle)
589 schedule_work(&dev_priv->opregion.asle_work);
590}
591
592#define ACPI_EV_DISPLAY_SWITCH (1<<0)
593#define ACPI_EV_LID (1<<1)
594#define ACPI_EV_DOCK (1<<2)
595
596static struct intel_opregion *system_opregion;
597
598#ifdef __NetBSD__
599static void
600intel_opregion_video_event(ACPI_HANDLE hdl, uint32_t notify, void *opaque)
601{
602 device_t self = opaque;
603 struct opregion_acpi *acpi;
604
605 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("notify=0x%08x\n", notify);
606
607 if (!system_opregion)
608 return;
609
610 acpi = system_opregion->acpi;
611
612 if (notify != 0x80) {
613 aprint_error_dev(self, "unknown notify 0x%02x\n", notify);
614 } else if ((acpi->cevt & 1) == 0) {
615 aprint_error_dev(self, "bad notify\n");
616 }
617
618 acpi->csts = 0;
619}
620#else /* !__NetBSD__ */
621static int intel_opregion_video_event(struct notifier_block *nb,
622 unsigned long val, void *data)
623{
624 /* The only video events relevant to opregion are 0x80. These indicate
625 either a docking event, lid switch or display switch request. In
626 Linux, these are handled by the dock, button and video drivers.
627 */
628
629 struct acpi_bus_event *event = data;
630 struct opregion_acpi *acpi;
631 int ret = NOTIFY_OK;
632
633 if (strcmp(event->device_class, ACPI_VIDEO_CLASS) != 0)
634 return NOTIFY_DONE;
635
636 if (!system_opregion)
637 return NOTIFY_DONE;
638
639 acpi = system_opregion->acpi;
640
641 if (event->type == 0x80 && ((acpi->cevt & 1) == 0))
642 ret = NOTIFY_BAD;
643
644 acpi->csts = 0;
645
646 return ret;
647}
648#endif
649
650#ifndef __NetBSD__
651static struct notifier_block intel_opregion_notifier = {
652 .notifier_call = intel_opregion_video_event,
653};
654#endif
655
656/*
657 * Initialise the DIDL field in opregion. This passes a list of devices to
658 * the firmware. Values are defined by section B.4.2 of the ACPI specification
659 * (version 3)
660 */
661
662static u32 get_did(struct intel_opregion *opregion, int i)
663{
664 u32 did;
665
666 if (i < ARRAY_SIZE(opregion->acpi->didl)) {
667 did = opregion->acpi->didl[i];
668 } else {
669 i -= ARRAY_SIZE(opregion->acpi->didl);
670
671 if (WARN_ON(i >= ARRAY_SIZE(opregion->acpi->did2)))
672 return 0;
673
674 did = opregion->acpi->did2[i];
675 }
676
677 return did;
678}
679
680static void set_did(struct intel_opregion *opregion, int i, u32 val)
681{
682 if (i < ARRAY_SIZE(opregion->acpi->didl)) {
683 opregion->acpi->didl[i] = val;
684 } else {
685 i -= ARRAY_SIZE(opregion->acpi->didl);
686
687 if (WARN_ON(i >= ARRAY_SIZE(opregion->acpi->did2)))
688 return;
689
690 opregion->acpi->did2[i] = val;
691 }
692}
693
694static void intel_didl_outputs(struct drm_device *dev)
695{
696 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
697 struct intel_opregion *opregion = &dev_priv->opregion;
698 struct drm_connector *connector;
699#ifdef __NetBSD__
700 struct acpi_devnode *ad, *child;
701 ACPI_INTEGER device_id;
702 ACPI_STATUS status;
703#else
704 acpi_handle handle;
705 struct acpi_device *acpi_dev, *acpi_cdev, *acpi_video_bus = NULL;
706 unsigned long long device_id;
707 acpi_status status;
708#endif
709 u32 temp, max_outputs;
710 int i = 0;
711
712#ifdef __NetBSD__
713 ad = dev->pdev->pd_ad;
714 if (ad == NULL ||
715 ad->ad_device == NULL ||
716 !device_is_a(ad->ad_device, "acpivga"))
717 return;
718#else
719 handle = ACPI_HANDLE(&dev->pdev->dev);
720 if (!handle || acpi_bus_get_device(handle, &acpi_dev))
721 return;
722
723 if (acpi_is_video_device(handle))
724 acpi_video_bus = acpi_dev;
725 else {
726 list_for_each_entry(acpi_cdev, &acpi_dev->children, node) {
727 if (acpi_is_video_device(acpi_cdev->handle)) {
728 acpi_video_bus = acpi_cdev;
729 break;
730 }
731 }
732 }
733
734 if (!acpi_video_bus) {
735 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("No ACPI video bus found\n");
736 return;
737 }
738#endif
739
740 /*
741 * In theory, did2, the extended didl, gets added at opregion version
742 * 3.0. In practice, however, we're supposed to set it for earlier
743 * versions as well, since a BIOS that doesn't understand did2 should
744 * not look at it anyway. Use a variable so we can tweak this if a need
745 * arises later.
746 */
747 max_outputs = ARRAY_SIZE(opregion->acpi->didl) +
748 ARRAY_SIZE(opregion->acpi->did2);
749
750#ifdef __NetBSD__
751 SIMPLEQ_FOREACH(child, &ad->ad_child_head, ad_child_list)
752#else
753 list_for_each_entry(acpi_cdev, &acpi_video_bus->children, node)
754#endif
755 {
756 if (i >= max_outputs) {
757 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("More than %u outputs detected via ACPI\n",
758 max_outputs);
759 return;
760 }
761#ifdef __NetBSD__
762 status = acpi_eval_integer(child->ad_handle, "_ADR",
763 &device_id);
764#else
765 status = acpi_evaluate_integer(acpi_cdev->handle, "_ADR",
766 NULL, &device_id);
767#endif
768 if (ACPI_SUCCESS(status)) {
769 if (!device_id)
770 goto blind_set;
771 set_did(opregion, i++, (u32)(device_id & 0x0f0f));
772 }
773 }
774
775end:
776 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("%d outputs detected\n", i);
777
778 /* If fewer than max outputs, the list must be null terminated */
779 if (i < max_outputs)
780 set_did(opregion, i, 0);
781 return;
782
783blind_set:
784 i = 0;
785 list_for_each_entry(connector, &dev->mode_config.connector_list, head) {
786 int output_type = ACPI_OTHER_OUTPUT;
787 if (i >= max_outputs) {
788 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("More than %u outputs in connector list\n",
789 max_outputs);
790 return;
791 }
792 switch (connector->connector_type) {
793 case DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_VGA:
794 case DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_DVIA:
795 output_type = ACPI_VGA_OUTPUT;
796 break;
797 case DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_Composite:
798 case DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_SVIDEO:
799 case DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_Component:
800 case DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_9PinDIN:
801 output_type = ACPI_TV_OUTPUT;
802 break;
803 case DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_DVII:
804 case DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_DVID:
805 case DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_DisplayPort:
806 case DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_HDMIA:
807 case DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_HDMIB:
808 output_type = ACPI_DIGITAL_OUTPUT;
809 break;
810 case DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_LVDS:
811 output_type = ACPI_LVDS_OUTPUT;
812 break;
813 }
814 temp = get_did(opregion, i);
815 set_did(opregion, i, temp | (1 << 31) | output_type | i);
816 i++;
817 }
818 goto end;
819}
820
821static void intel_setup_cadls(struct drm_device *dev)
822{
823 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
824 struct intel_opregion *opregion = &dev_priv->opregion;
825 int i = 0;
826 u32 disp_id;
827
828 /* Initialize the CADL field by duplicating the DIDL values.
829 * Technically, this is not always correct as display outputs may exist,
830 * but not active. This initialization is necessary for some Clevo
831 * laptops that check this field before processing the brightness and
832 * display switching hotkeys. Just like DIDL, CADL is NULL-terminated if
833 * there are less than eight devices. */
834 do {
835 disp_id = get_did(opregion, i);
836 opregion->acpi->cadl[i] = disp_id;
837 } while (++i < 8 && disp_id != 0);
838}
839
840void intel_opregion_init(struct drm_device *dev)
841{
842 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
843 struct intel_opregion *opregion = &dev_priv->opregion;
844
845 if (!opregion->header)
846 return;
847
848 if (opregion->acpi) {
849 intel_didl_outputs(dev);
850 intel_setup_cadls(dev);
851
852 /* Notify BIOS we are ready to handle ACPI video ext notifs.
853 * Right now, all the events are handled by the ACPI video module.
854 * We don't actually need to do anything with them. */
855 opregion->acpi->csts = 0;
856 opregion->acpi->drdy = 1;
857
858 system_opregion = opregion;
859#ifdef __NetBSD__
860 if (dev->pdev->pd_ad != NULL)
861 acpi_register_notify(dev->pdev->pd_ad,
862 intel_opregion_video_event);
863#else
864 register_acpi_notifier(&intel_opregion_notifier);
865#endif
866 }
867
868 if (opregion->asle) {
869 opregion->asle->tche = ASLE_TCHE_BLC_EN;
870 opregion->asle->ardy = ASLE_ARDY_READY;
871 }
872}
873
874void intel_opregion_fini(struct drm_device *dev)
875{
876 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
877 struct intel_opregion *opregion = &dev_priv->opregion;
878
879 if (!opregion->header)
880 return;
881
882 if (opregion->asle)
883 opregion->asle->ardy = ASLE_ARDY_NOT_READY;
884
885 cancel_work_sync(&dev_priv->opregion.asle_work);
886
887 if (opregion->acpi) {
888 opregion->acpi->drdy = 0;
889
890 system_opregion = NULL;
891#ifdef __NetBSD__
892 if (dev->pdev->pd_ad != NULL)
893 acpi_deregister_notify(dev->pdev->pd_ad);
894#else
895 unregister_acpi_notifier(&intel_opregion_notifier);
896#endif
897 }
898
899 /* just clear all opregion memory pointers now */
900#ifdef __NetBSD__
901 bus_space_unmap(opregion->bst, opregion->bsh, OPREGION_SIZE);
902#else
903 memunmap(opregion->header);
904#endif
905 opregion->header = NULL;
906 opregion->acpi = NULL;
907 opregion->swsci = NULL;
908 opregion->asle = NULL;
909 opregion->vbt = NULL;
910 opregion->lid_state = NULL;
911}
912
913static void swsci_setup(struct drm_device *dev)
914{
915 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
916 struct intel_opregion *opregion = &dev_priv->opregion;
917 bool requested_callbacks = false;
918 u32 tmp;
919
920 /* Sub-function code 0 is okay, let's allow them. */
921 opregion->swsci_gbda_sub_functions = 1;
922 opregion->swsci_sbcb_sub_functions = 1;
923
924 /* We use GBDA to ask for supported GBDA calls. */
925 if (swsci(dev, SWSCI_GBDA_SUPPORTED_CALLS, 0, &tmp) == 0) {
926 /* make the bits match the sub-function codes */
927 tmp <<= 1;
928 opregion->swsci_gbda_sub_functions |= tmp;
929 }
930
931 /*
932 * We also use GBDA to ask for _requested_ SBCB callbacks. The driver
933 * must not call interfaces that are not specifically requested by the
934 * bios.
935 */
936 if (swsci(dev, SWSCI_GBDA_REQUESTED_CALLBACKS, 0, &tmp) == 0) {
937 /* here, the bits already match sub-function codes */
938 opregion->swsci_sbcb_sub_functions |= tmp;
939 requested_callbacks = true;
940 }
941
942 /*
943 * But we use SBCB to ask for _supported_ SBCB calls. This does not mean
944 * the callback is _requested_. But we still can't call interfaces that
945 * are not requested.
946 */
947 if (swsci(dev, SWSCI_SBCB_SUPPORTED_CALLBACKS, 0, &tmp) == 0) {
948 /* make the bits match the sub-function codes */
949 u32 low = tmp & 0x7ff;
950 u32 high = tmp & ~0xfff; /* bit 11 is reserved */
951 tmp = (high << 4) | (low << 1) | 1;
952
953 /* best guess what to do with supported wrt requested */
954 if (requested_callbacks) {
955 u32 req = opregion->swsci_sbcb_sub_functions;
956 if ((req & tmp) != req)
957 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("SWSCI BIOS requested (%08x) SBCB callbacks that are not supported (%08x)\n", req, tmp);
958 /* XXX: for now, trust the requested callbacks */
959 /* opregion->swsci_sbcb_sub_functions &= tmp; */
960 } else {
961 opregion->swsci_sbcb_sub_functions |= tmp;
962 }
963 }
964
965 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("SWSCI GBDA callbacks %08x, SBCB callbacks %08x\n",
966 opregion->swsci_gbda_sub_functions,
967 opregion->swsci_sbcb_sub_functions);
968}
969#else /* CONFIG_ACPI */
970static inline void swsci_setup(struct drm_device *dev) {}
971#endif /* CONFIG_ACPI */
972
973int intel_opregion_setup(struct drm_device *dev)
974{
975 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
976 struct intel_opregion *opregion = &dev_priv->opregion;
977 u32 asls, mboxes;
978 char buf[sizeof(OPREGION_SIGNATURE)];
979 int err = 0;
980 void *base;
981
982 BUILD_BUG_ON(sizeof(struct opregion_header) != 0x100);
983 BUILD_BUG_ON(sizeof(struct opregion_acpi) != 0x100);
984 BUILD_BUG_ON(sizeof(struct opregion_swsci) != 0x100);
985 BUILD_BUG_ON(sizeof(struct opregion_asle) != 0x100);
986
987 pci_read_config_dword(dev->pdev, PCI_ASLS, &asls);
988 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("graphic opregion physical addr: 0x%x\n", asls);
989 if (asls == 0) {
990 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("ACPI OpRegion not supported!\n");
991 return -ENOTSUPP;
992 }
993
994#ifdef CONFIG_ACPI
995 INIT_WORK(&opregion->asle_work, asle_work);
996#endif
997#ifdef __NetBSD__
998 opregion->bst = dev->pdev->pd_pa.pa_memt;
999 err = -bus_space_map(opregion->bst, asls, OPREGION_SIZE,
1000 BUS_SPACE_MAP_LINEAR|BUS_SPACE_MAP_PREFETCHABLE, &opregion->bsh);
1001 if (err) {
1002 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Failed to map opregion: %d\n", err);
1003 return err;
1004 }
1005 base = bus_space_vaddr(opregion->bst, opregion->bsh);
1006#else
1007 base = memremap(asls, OPREGION_SIZE, MEMREMAP_WB);
1008#endif
1009 if (!base)
1010 return -ENOMEM;
1011
1012 memcpy(buf, base, sizeof(buf));
1013
1014 if (memcmp(buf, OPREGION_SIGNATURE, 16)) {
1015 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("opregion signature mismatch\n");
1016 err = -EINVAL;
1017 goto err_out;
1018 }
1019 opregion->header = base;
1020 opregion->vbt = (char *)base + OPREGION_VBT_OFFSET;
1021
1022 opregion->lid_state = (void *)((char *)base + ACPI_CLID);
1023
1024 mboxes = opregion->header->mboxes;
1025 if (mboxes & MBOX_ACPI) {
1026 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Public ACPI methods supported\n");
1027 opregion->acpi = (void *)((char *)base + OPREGION_ACPI_OFFSET);
1028 }
1029
1030 if (mboxes & MBOX_SWSCI) {
1031 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("SWSCI supported\n");
1032 opregion->swsci = (void *)((char *)base + OPREGION_SWSCI_OFFSET);
1033 swsci_setup(dev);
1034 }
1035 if (mboxes & MBOX_ASLE) {
1036 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("ASLE supported\n");
1037 opregion->asle = (void *)((char *)base + OPREGION_ASLE_OFFSET);
1038
1039 opregion->asle->ardy = ASLE_ARDY_NOT_READY;
1040 }
1041
1042 return 0;
1043
1044err_out:
1045#ifdef __NetBSD__
1046 bus_space_unmap(opregion->bst, opregion->bsh, OPREGION_SIZE);
1047#else
1048 memunmap(base);
1049#endif
1050 return err;
1051}
1052
1053#endif /* CONFIG_ACPI */
